intro: Graminastrum, commonly known as the grassland beauty, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The flowers of Graminastrum are typically small and clustered in panicles, often with a feathery appearance. These plants are native to various regions of the Americas and are often found in open, sunny habitats. They play an important role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
